definition.name: Toggle
definition.purpose: A stylable toggle button component for UI state switching
definition.description: A reusable toggle button component built on top of Radix UI's TogglePrimitive. Supports variant and size props for style customization, and passes through all native toggle props. Used for toggling UI states such as on/off, active/inactive, etc.

variant.description: Visual style variant of the toggle (default, outline)

size.description: Size of the toggle (default, sm, lg)

initial.data: Toggle is in its default (off) state

visible: A button styled according to the selected variant and size
enabled: Clicking the button to toggle state

effects: The toggle state changes to on, and the button style updates accordingly

when.description: User clicks the toggle button again

effects: The toggle state changes to off, and the button style updates accordingly

definition.visualLayout: A button with customizable size and style, optionally containing icons or text, styled according to the variant and state.
definition.implementationNotes: Wraps Radix UI TogglePrimitive.Root. Uses class-variance-authority for style variants and a cn utility for class merging.

declarations.name: toggleVariants
declarations.description: A class-variance-authority (cva) configuration for the Toggle component, defining style variants and sizes.

size.description: Size of the toggle (default, sm, lg)

returns.description: A string of CSS classes based on the selected variant and size

declarations.implementationNotes: Uses class-variance-authority to generate class names for the Toggle component based on variant and size.
